CIPHER.0.cipherString: You have to accept whatever comes and the only important thing is that you meet it with courage and with the best that you have to give.
CIPHER.0.question: Solve this aristocrat.

CIPHER.1.cipherString: When you get successful, you can do pretty much whatever you want.
CIPHER.1.question: Solve this aristocrat.

CIPHER.2.cipherString: You can't build an adaptable organization without adaptable people - and individuals change only when they have to, or when they want to.
CIPHER.2.question: Solve this aristocrat. The letter I maps to C.

CIPHER.3.cipherString: We are all hungry and thirsty for concrete images. Abstract art will have been good for one thing: to restore its exact virginity to figurative art.
CIPHER.3.question: Solve this aristocrat. The first word is We.

CIPHER.4.cipherString: It was actually a very nice little book done by a gift book company. They illustrated it with pictures from 1920s football, before there were face guards.
CIPHER.4.question: Solve this patristocrat.

CIPHER.5.cipherString: What I've really learned over time is that optimism is a very, very important part of leadership.
CIPHER.5.question: Solve this patristocrat. The letter X maps to I.

CIPHER.6.cipherString: We want far better reasons for having children than not knowing how to prevent them.
CIPHER.6.question: Solve this patristocrat. The first word is We.

CIPHER.7.cipherString: Nunca hables bien de ti ni provoques que otros lo hagan, pues, entonces, todos ellos dirán entre sí, lo soberbio que eres
CIPHER.7.question: Solve this xenocrypt. The letter  maps to A.

CIPHER.8.cipherString: I like to listen. I have learned a great deal from listening carefully. Most people never listen.
CIPHER.8.question: Decode this sentence which has been encoded with an Affine cipher. (a,b)=(11,24).

CIPHER.9.cipherString: I always tell people a clean cooking area is a clean mind which is available for the creativity.
CIPHER.9.question: Encode this sentence with the Affine cipher. (a,b)=(21,9).

CIPHER.10.cipherString: It is not from the benevolence of the butcher, the brewer, or the baker that we expect our dinner, but from their regard to their own interest.
CIPHER.10.question: Decode this sentence which has been encoded with an Affine cipher. The letters G and L map to B and S.

CIPHER.11.cipherString: A reading man and woman is a ready man and woman, but a writing man and woman is exact.
CIPHER.11.question: Decode this sentence which has been encoded with an Caesar cipher.

CIPHER.12.cipherString: Every luxury must be paid for, and everything is a luxury, starting with being in this world.
CIPHER.12.question: Encode this sentence with the Caesar cipher with offset 12.

CIPHER.13.cipherString: To me, all war is failure for humanity, though it often is a bounty for commerce.
CIPHER.13.question: Solve this quote which has been encoded with the Atbash Cipher.

CIPHER.14.cipherString: Few men have virtue to withstand the highest bidder.

CIPHER.15.cipherString: For the last five years I've been in the production business.

CIPHER.16.cipherString: Violence and arms can never resolve the problems of men.

CIPHER.17.cipherString: Most people don't realize turkeys are friendly, they're social, they're loyal, they have emotions.

CIPHER.18.cipherString: Our culture runs on coffee and gasoline, the first often tasting like the second.

CIPHER.19.cipherString: Put your heart, mind, and soul into even your smallest acts. This is the secret of success.

CIPHER.20.cipherString: If you want peace, you don't talk to your friends. You talk to your enemies.
